title: Leisurely lunch at Longleat!
text: On Saturday, our eldest son and his wife held their 30th birthday party at Longleat. The day was a spectacular success, which was mainly due to the setting, food, staff and wines at the estate. Guido, Sandra and their staff were incredibly welcoming and interested that we had everything we needed. The food was superb and the wines were excellent. Fabulous party destination. There was plenty of room for the children to wander amongst the vines, and Pedro the dog was a fabulous addition.

title: Leisurely, luscious lunch.
text: We stumbled onto 'Heaven' looking for a lunch spot close to our hotel, Mercure Excelsior. The owners could not have been more accommodating. I think we were there during Siesta, and we'd already read signs at our hotel about power outagages. The young man at the front of house could not have been more helpful or accommodating. As we were a group of 9, and some of us were larger than average, he seriously went out of his way to re-arrange the furniture in one salon to accommodate us all very comfortably. He was obviously distressed when the power went out, and took many measures to ensure we were cool and comfortable. The serves of food were very generous (next time, we'll share!!!), the range of food was great, the drinks were reasonably priced, and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

title: Very close to all the action!
text: We never worry about the age of an Hotel, and believe that the older hotels often have the bigger rooms and en suites. The Excelsior is no exception! The hotel is huge, and depending on the location of your room, you can add 200 steps to your daily count just going from the elevator to your door!!! The hotel was spotlessly clean, had great facilities, and, like almost every hotel we've stayed in in Italy, the domestic staff were fantastic! They were friendly, helpful, and had great senses of humour. This was particularly evident on the morning neither of our keycards would work. The gorgeous made came up, tried our two cards, and then sort of waved hers in front of us, as though it was magic. Nothing happened, and the three of us fell about laughing! She quickly phoned for help, and within minutes we were back in our room!!! We were particularly impressed by the pride in which the wait staff in the various eating areas took wit their work. Everything from bread to crockery and cutlery through to food serving areas was immaculate. It was an absolute pleasure to eat there. The central location of the hotel was also great. There were many, many restaurants within an easy walking distance, and the prices fitted all budgets. My only criticism (and it's the same criticism I've had for most of the hotels we've stayed in in Italy this time) was of the Reception Staff. Their arrogance and rudeness had to be seen to be believed. At the end of our stay, I queued behind one of our group to tell the Reception staff how wonderful the domestic staff had been. As the receptionist chose to deal with four other guests, I walked away.

title: Stunning Spritzers!
text: After a long, hot walk through a very busy Positano, we were lucky enough to find this delightful little café. The staff were very helpful, caring and polite. Nothing was too much trouble for them, and they were always cheery. The spritzers were to die for! They were very cold and delicious -- just what we needed!

title: Vista of Vesuvius
text: Our stay in this hotel was really lovely. The location was spectacular, and the skills of the shuttle bus driver had to be seen to be believed! The domestic staff were just excellent with their service, attention to detail and senses of humour. However, the male reception staff were rude, sexist and arrogant. The breakfasts were superb, the views from the balcony were mind blowing, and the food was excellent. The regular shuttle bus was a huge bonus. Each trip saved us A$38 per trip in taxi fares. The management and the drivers were also incredibly generous in taking small groups to the pick up points for other tours, and also picking us up at the same points. Make the effort to sit on the balcony for the sunset!

title: Revealing Ruins
text: Our walking tour of Pompeii was quite good. Our female guide was incredibly knowledgeable about all things Pompeii, and we appreciated Mira’s flexibility with the timetable%. An absolutely brilliant tour of Pompeii!

title: Luxury at a budget friendly price.
text: To say that the views from the front of this hotel are exceptional is an absolute understatement! Regardless of the weather, there is always something brilliant to observe from one vantage point or another. The hotel is spotless, the artworks are quirky, and the regular shuttle bus to and from the station is amazing! Add the regularity of the service, to the drivers’ sheer skill, and the €25 saving in cab fares is exceptional value. The sunsetsviewed from the pool deck are simply stunning, and easy to photograph from the patio above the pool deck area.The only downside for my female friends and me was the arrogant, disdainful attitudes we received from one of the male receptionists, and several of the male waiters. As women, we are more than capable of handing our keys into reception when leaving the hotel. Similarly, women can enjoy an espresso coffee just as much as a man can. Women do not need to be ignored at the front desk, in favour of a male occupant of the hotel. Similarly, women are quite capable of ordering, and drinking, an espresso without the eye-rolling from a waiter. Gentlemen, good manners cost nothing.

title: Right at the front door.
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our four or five experiences at Binario Calmo. The food was delicious, the serves were generous, and the prices were very reasonable. The staff were quite good, although Sofia was excellent! We had great fun with her, and she was incredibly helpful. Just be aware of the cover charge.

title: Stay at Stelle!
text:
We just loved our few days in Stelle! The rooms were generous, the bathroom great, and we spent quite some tome watching the cars and people on the street from our first floor balcony.

The cafe and restaurant next door served delicious, reasonably priced food and drinks, and the service was excellent.

There were plenty of dining options within a short walking distance, as well as a supermarket and pharmacies.

The Reception staff could not have been more helpful, and each staff member was very polite.

title: Authentic Greek food and traditional hospitality!
text: We loved this little restaurant for a number of reasons. Firstly, the owners were just fabulous! They were very friendly, remembered us, and spoilt us with little treats. Secondly, the food was fantastic. It was fresh and delicious. You can tell the food is fresh when you can hear the salad being chopped up, and your fish sizzling! The prices were more than reasonable, and the servings were big enough for us to share dishes. Thirdly, the cafe was about fifty steps from our hotel. Consequently, we ate lunches and dinners there. Although the decor was not luxurious, it met all our requirements and was spotless. Love, love, loved it!

title: A Little Slice of Heaven at Hermes
text: The Hermes Hotel was just a delightful place in which to stay! With only 45 rooms, the staff very quickly learned our names and room numbers. All staff were incredibly helpful, polite and friendly. Their advice was accurate and supportive, and the reception staff all spoke a number of languages fluently. The rooms were spotless, a good size, and the ensuite was very good. Additionally, the breakfast was great! The location was superb, being in the older part of Athens. It was literally a walk from the Acropolis and Parthenon, the Ancient Agora, Orthodox Churches, the Cathedral, Hadrian's Arch and Library, etc., etc., etc. It was also slap bang in the middle of fantastic cafes, restaurants and shops -- from little souvenir shops, to upmarket designers. The rooftop terrace was a wonderful surprise,and you could improve on your view with a visit to the terrace on the sister hotel, Hotel Plaka. We will definitely return!

title: Priceless views!
text: We had two dinners at this delightful restaurant, and recommend you try it for yourself! The climb to the terrace may be slightly difficult if you have health problems, but the views will soon make you forget the effort! We dined at sunset, and were able to not only watch the sun set, we were able to watch the city lights come on, and watch planes line up to land at Ataturk Airport. The food was delicious, the cost was reasonable and the service was superb! We were all incredibly impressed that our waiter remembered us a few nights later! Do it, people!!

title: A Step Back in Time.
text: We recently spent three nights at the Dara Hotel. The location of this quaint, little, family owned hotel was just excellent! We travelled with a friend who has health problems, and even he was able to walk to Ayasofya, Topkapi, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and Orient Express Railway Station. The hotel was also just a short distance from the tram line. The proximity to various mosques also allowed us to experience the 'Calls to Prayer'--perhaps not a bonus for light sleepers. The traffic noise on the cobblestones may also be annoying to some.The breakfast was delicious, and dining on the terrace overlooking the sea and the line up of ships of all sizes was incredible! The staff were very helpful, polite and friendly, and the hotel was very clean.

title: Simply stunning.
text: This museum is one of the best I've seen! The artefacts were amazing, and the information was very helpful as well as incredibly interesting. The location is an added bonus, as you can sit in the coffee shop, overlooking the water. This is particularly pretty at sunset, as you can see the city lights come on. Make it your number one place to visit in Doha!

title: Shop until you drop!
text: The Souq Waqif was brilliant for a number of reasons. The renovation of the buildings in the original style was beautiful. The presence of everyday Qatari shopkeepers and shoppers added further credibility and authenticity. The variety of goods was amazing, and the prices were very reasonable. The proximity to the square and the more modern, air-conditioned souqs was also impressive. A must see!

title: A wealth of information!
text: This centre was well worth a visit. The information about Islam was not only incredibly interesting, it was also very open and inclusive of other religions. Loved it!

title: The Pearl Monument
text: We came across this monument quite by accident! However, we were struck by its size, simplicity and beauty.

title: What an oasis!
text: Villagio is a true surprise! We left our driver at the front door, complaining about the heat on the walk to the entrance. Our grumpiness soon disappeared as we entered the very cool, and amazingly decorated Villagio foyer! The entire interior is designed to look like Venice -- down to the canals and gondola rides, and the blue sky with some puffy clouds! Set aside some time to wander in the cool atmosphere where you can enjoy shopping, dining and even the movies!

title: A hidden gem!
text: The location of the Saraya Corniche on West Bay, Doha was brilliant! It is within easy walking disatnce of the Sooq district, the Museum of Islamic Art, the harbour and the Muslim Cultural Centre. The staff are very friendly, helpful and supportive. The rooms are gorgeous, and the bathrooms are great. The breakfasts are good, and two restaurants in the hotel are quite good. However, if you want a room with a view, ensure you avoid rooms 09-12 on each floor. And, a real bonus is that you can drink the tap water -- very handy in 41 degree heat! There is easy access to the taxi service, and there are drivers affiliated with the hotel, to take you where you'd like to go.

title: Fabulous fare in Ricardo's!
text: Yesterday we met a friend for lunch at Ricardo's. We were at first a little disappointed that there appeared to be no free tables. However, the friendly staff quickly pointed out that the 'Reserved' signs on some tables were to ensure larger groups could easily find a seat. We were also pleasantly surprised by the playground, and the extensive, heated outdoor area. The menu was wide-ranging, the coffee was excellent and the food was delicious. The servings were very generous, and the cakes were true works of art. A great experience!

title: Moving memorial every day
text: The Australian War Memorial is an outstanding collection of artefacts and displays. You could honestly spend a number of days experiencing them all. The absolute highlight is the 4.30pm salute to a fallen soldier every day. Do it!

title: Just Enjoying Jetjas!
text: We just love Jetjas! The staff are incredibly accomodating (today 9 of us rocked up with no booking, and we were easily seated!), attentive and polite. The staff ask all the 'right' questions eg How would you like your eggs? Poached, fried? And how would you like them? Runny, Set? The staff are also incredibly patient with young children being encouraged to use them manners when ordering their food. The range of breakfast meals is extensive, and the serves are generous. And, the coffee is fantastic! I am torn between singing their praises at Jetjas, and keeping such a wonderful place and experience a secret!

title: Great place for a party!
text: Last Friday evening, a small group of us dined at Bohjass for a birthday party. The staff were incredibly welcoming, and made us feel right at home. The service was good; the staff fed our 4 and 8 year olds first; and the atmosphere was calm. The food was outstanding! The salmon was the best I've ever had, and the serving of calamari was particularly generous. Will certainly be going back!

title: Fabulous food, stunning service
text: The food served at The Last Straw is always freshly cooked, and the meals are always pleasing to the eye. I am impressed that I can order the omelette whether or not it's on the menu. The service I experienced before Christmas was simply outstanding. The young waitress was incredibly patient and understanding of a couple of very particular guests. Cannot wait to go back!

title: Brilliant experience!
text: Last week, I had the very great privilege of being taken to 'Lady Brock' in Brisbane. The experience was just wonderful! Gloria, the owner, was absolutely fabulous! I was very impressed that she knew my friend's name, and even took the time to learn mine. The clothing, handbags, jewellery etc were very reasonably priced, and the coffee was divine. Make an effort, and experience it for yourself!

title: Deliciousness in one place!
text: We had been advised by three groups of friends to try 'Village Duck' in KL. It completely exceeded out expectations! The service was great, the menu was amazing ( not sure about the 'Stir Fried Bullfrog!) and the food was divine. Couldn't go past the duck, the pork ribs or the prawn dumplings. The crispy seaweed was unbelievabe! A must visit in KL.

title: Highlights of Seven Terraces
text: The management and staff at Seven Terraces have to be seen to be believed! As this is a small hotel, the managerial staff know, and use, your names. If your are ill, as my husband is, the staff organise drs appointments and transport. They follow this up with regular enquiries about his health. The staff are so accommodating, that it is almost like you only need to think about wanting something, and the staff are there. The wonderful manners shown by the staff is absolutely remarkable. The breakfast, dining room, afternoon tea, tour guides and restaurant have to be experienced to be believed. Cannot wait to share our experience with friends and family, and certainly cannot wait to return!

title: Walking Tour of historical Florence
text: Today we participated in a brilliant walking tour with the outstanding Valentina Guadagni! As we range in age from 52 to 71, we were impressed by the pace at which she walked. She was incredibly knowledgeable without being boring in the slightest. We also really enjoyed her sense of humour.

title: A hidden treasure
text:
This is a great, quit little place to stay. I am impressed by the commitment to the environment. This hotel only replaces you towels when you leave them on the floor, there is no endless supply of shower caps, shoe polishing gear, soap, shampoo, conditioner, combs etc. Liquid soap and shampoo are in good sized dispensers on the wall of the shower. The hotel is only 10-15 minute walk to the beach, Seminyak Square and and a number of wonderful restaurants such as Ku De Ta and Potato Head Beach Club, and you experience the sights, sounds and smells of Seminyak on the way. There are also tiny little shops about 75m away where you can buy 1.5L of water for .50c.Three shuttle services run every day, but cab fares are a pittance. The food at breakfast is good, but the lunch and dinner menus are not only varied, the food is beautiful and the prices are
more than reasonable. The pool is really lovely, and various flotation devices are available for adults and children. The major highlight is the staff, for whom nothing is too much bother. Their patience with 'ugly' tourists is worthy of beatification! I would certainly stay again, but maybe not next to the gym.
